description.narrative: Legal (including juvenile justice) and social services at the provincial levels have increase institutional capacity to protect children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, boys and girls in Thailand are increasingly protected from violence, neglect and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Legal (including juvenile justice) and social services at the provincial levels have increase institutional capacity to protect children

description.narrative: Reinforcement of child protection capacity at provincial level, the hub of specialist work, continued in 2019. Professionals standards on child protection for social workers moved forward, while expert training on child protection for public prosecutors advanced, increasing the provincial coverage of these specialized justice personnel. The Ministry of Public Health further developed its surveillance and case management tools. A model of technical support was used to contribute to training by the courts and security personnel in armed-violence-affected southern Thailand. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of provinces that have applied diversion measures in at least 50 per cent of qualified cases (pre-trial)

Extent to which case management procedures are being implemented in DCY shelters: Level 1: Assessment of case management function of targeted DCY shelter Level 2: Standard tool on case management developed for DCY shelter Level 3: Capacity of DCY shelter staff in 3 targeted provinces being developed Level 4: Monitoring mechanism on case management developed and implemented Level 5: At least 50 percent of DCY shelters in 3 targeted provinces have standard case management procedures

Level of implementation of case management information system: Level 1: formal government commitment to implement case management system Level 2: Assessment of current CP information system in health sector in Thailand Level 3: Development/ adaptation of case management for Thailand completed Level 4: Users trained Level 5: Case management information system operational and piloted in 100% of MOPH OSCCs in Region 8

Extent to which the capacity of public prosecutors on child protection is strengthened Level 1: UNICEF-supported Curriculum for training developed Level 2: Regional centres for protection of children and family established in all 9 regions Level 3: Regional centres are mandated to ensure capacity-building of provincial public prosecutors related to child protection based on the curriculum
